abstracts.cdata!:
The Dhaka Urban Transport Project will
            improve transport infrastructure, and services in the
            city's metropolitan area, including road improvement,
            traffic management, and construction of terminals. During
            the construction phase, major environmental impacts include
            air, and noise pollution, and, traffic disruption. Soil
            contamination is expected to rise during construction, and
            sludge discharges will occur. Mitigating measures include:
            regulation of roadsides, and systems to control oil
            spillage, as well as dissipation structures, and settlement
            basins to control drainage, and erosion. The Air Pollution
            Advisory Committee of stakeholders, will establish action
            plans, to control vehicular gas emissions, regulate testing
            in academic laboratories, and ensure effectiveness of air
            control programs, in addition to public awareness campaigns,
            and training. Noise barriers will be established at
            congested locations, and trees/shrubs will be planted as a
            practical effect to reduce traffic noise nuisances. Surface
            and groundwater pollution control, include the provision of
            dustbins, and the establishment of waste disposal locations.
            Legislative requirements should address the protection of
            flood zones, and those where discharges may disturb the
            quality of surface, or ground water. Project design would
            avoid sensitive areas to prevent adversity on flora, and
            fauna, and in open spaces and parks.
